intro: Cavendishia orthosepala, commonly known as the yellow orchid, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a distinctive orange lip, which adds to its ornamental value. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Cavendishia orthosepala thrives in warm, humid environments and requires indirect sunlight for optimal growth.
